page.title: 08RECREATION IN SOUTH ST JOHNS
page.content: Leisure facilities exist for adults & children,especially near the Lower Wick housing estate.Grown ups may go to the British Legion Club or the Maple Leaf Public House,while their children can play on 2 small parks which are equipped with swings,seesaws & roundabouts.Youngsters often play on the grassy patch at the centre of the estate,known as the Green.The banks of the River Teme & Laugherne Brook provide opportunities for bracing walks,fishing and even bathing. To the north of the estate is Boughton Park.This is open to members only,who may take advantaged of tennis & golf facilities & the luxurious club house makes their visits more enjoyable.The nearby Pitmaston Park is available to the public & is popular with ball players & dog owners.
